repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This avoids crashes in debug mode where CPython's access functions assert a type check (which fails for CyFunction).

Avoid excluding CyFunction from the fast-call fast-paths for 0/1 args in Python debug mode.
Also include the 1-arg (METH_O) case in the optimisation - I cannot see a reason why only 0-args should be special-cased for CyFunction.

Fix a bug in __Pyx_TryUnpackUnboundCMethod() where we checked for "defined(CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_PYPY)" (which is always true) instead of the defined 0/1 value.

Improves on https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/5031
Closes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4804

comment_data.body:
I'm a little worried about this in the limited API. i.e. will it cause CyFunctions to get passed to functions expecting a `PyCFunction` (bearing in mind that the limited API `CyFunction` doesn't even share the `PyCFunction` layout).

It probably doesn't matter because I suspect most of these are used for optimizations that are skipped in the limited API. But it feels like it could go wrong
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -75,6 +75,22 @@ typedef struct {
 #define __Pyx_IsCyOrPyCFunction(obj)  __Pyx_TypeCheck2(obj, __pyx_CyFunctionType, &PyCFunction_Type)
 #define __Pyx_CyFunction_CheckExact(obj)  __Pyx_IS_TYPE(obj, __pyx_CyFunctionType)
 
+// Redefine PyCFunction access functions to also support CyFunction.
+// We need our own copies because the inline functions in CPython have a type-check assert
+// that breaks with a CyFunction in debug mode.
+#undef __Pyx_PyCFunction_Check
+#define __Pyx_PyCFunction_Check(func)  __Pyx_IsCyOrPyCFunction(func)

comment_data.body:
I agree. I actually wanted to go the other way and make CyFunction inherit from `PyCMethod_Type` in the Limited API in order to make the function usages safe, but then noticed that this actually cannot work at all because the object struct isn't exposed.

I now think it would be better to make the usages explicit, i.e. allow CyFunction _and_ PyCFunction explicitly in the code, and then map the "either or" check function to a plain `PyCFunction_Check()` if CyFunction is _not_ available. That's safer than implicitly allowing both. I'll change that in the PR when I get to it.

@@ -75,6 +75,22 @@ typedef struct {

 #define __Pyx_CyFunction_CheckExact(obj)  __Pyx_IS_TYPE(obj, __pyx_CyFunctionType)
 
+// Redefine PyCFunction access functions to also support CyFunction.
+// We need our own copies because the inline functions in CPython have a type-check assert
+// that breaks with a CyFunction in debug mode.
+#undef __Pyx_PyCFunction_Check
+#define __Pyx_PyCFunction_Check(func)  __Pyx_IsCyOrPyCFunction(func)

@@ -75,6 +75,22 @@ typedef struct {
 #define __Pyx_IsCyOrPyCFunction(obj)  __Pyx_TypeCheck2(obj, __pyx_CyFunctionType, &PyCFunction_Type)
 #define __Pyx_CyFunction_CheckExact(obj)  __Pyx_IS_TYPE(obj, __pyx_CyFunctionType)
 
+// Redefine PyCFunction access functions to also support CyFunction.
+// We need our own copies because the inline functions in CPython have a type-check assert
+// that breaks with a CyFunction in debug mode.
+#undef __Pyx_PyCFunction_Check
+#define __Pyx_PyCFunction_Check(func)  __Pyx_IsCyOrPyCFunction(func)

comment_data.body: This seems to be being used in the limited API and probably just needs to be `PyCFunction_GetFunction` there
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -898,6 +898,35 @@ class __Pyx_FakeReference {
   #define __Pyx_PyVectorcall_NARGS(n)  ((Py_ssize_t)(n))
 #endif
 
+// These PyCFunction related macros get redefined in CythonFunction.c.
+// We need our own copies because the inline functions in CPython have a type-check assert
+// that breaks with a CyFunction in debug mode.
+#if PY_MAJOR_VERSION >= 0x030900B1
+#define __Pyx_PyCFunction_CheckExact(func)  PyCFunction_CheckExact(func)
+#else
+#define __Pyx_PyCFunction_CheckExact(func)  PyCFunction_Check(func)
+#endif
+#define __Pyx_CyOrPyCFunction_Check(func)  PyCFunction_Check(func)
+
+#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON
+#define __Pyx_CyOrPyCFunction_GET_FUNCTION(func)  (((PyCFunctionObject*)(func))->m_ml->ml_meth)
+#elif !CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API
+// It's probably easier for non-CPythons to support PyCFunction_GET_FUNCTION() than the object struct layout.
+#define __Pyx_CyOrPyCFunction_GET_FUNCTION(func)  PyCFunction_GET_FUNCTION(func)
+// Unused in CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API.
+#endif
+#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON
+#define __Pyx_CyOrPyCFunction_GET_FLAGS(func)  (((PyCFunctionObject*)(func))->m_ml->ml_flags)
+static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject* __Pyx_CyOrPyCFunction_GET_SELF(PyObject *func) {
+    return (__Pyx_CyOrPyCFunction_GET_FLAGS(func) & METH_STATIC) ? NULL : ((PyCFunctionObject*)func)->m_self;
+}
+// Only used if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON.
+#endif
+static CYTHON_INLINE int __Pyx__IsSameCFunction(PyObject *func, void *cfunc) {
+    return PyCFunction_Check(func) && PyCFunction_GET_FUNCTION(func) == (PyCFunction) cfunc;

comment_data.body:
> I actually wanted to go the other way and make CyFunction inherit from PyCMethod_Type in the Limited API in order to make the function usages safe, but then noticed that this actually cannot work at all because the object struct isn't exposed.

Yes - I did the refactoring to hold a pointer reluctantly for the Limited API but couldn't see much else that was likely to work.

> I hope you like https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/f1aef480e91501035b29a8f88715b35c018b829a better.

Yes - generally looks more explicit about what it's actually doing which I think is better.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -75,6 +75,22 @@ typedef struct {
 #define __Pyx_IsCyOrPyCFunction(obj)  __Pyx_TypeCheck2(obj, __pyx_CyFunctionType, &PyCFunction_Type)
 #define __Pyx_CyFunction_CheckExact(obj)  __Pyx_IS_TYPE(obj, __pyx_CyFunctionType)
 
+// Redefine PyCFunction access functions to also support CyFunction.
+// We need our own copies because the inline functions in CPython have a type-check assert
+// that breaks with a CyFunction in debug mode.
+#undef __Pyx_PyCFunction_Check
+#define __Pyx_PyCFunction_Check(func)  __Pyx_IsCyOrPyCFunction(func)

commit.message:
Clean up and simplify the special handling of PyCFunction and CyFunction. This avoids crashes in debug mode where CPython's access functions assert a type check (which fails for CyFunction).
Avoid excluding CyFunction from the fast-call fast-paths for 0/1 args in Python debug mode. Also include the 1-arg (METH_O) case in the optimisation - I cannot see a reason why only 0-args should be special-cased for CyFunction.
Fix a bug in __Pyx_TryUnpackUnboundCMethod() where we checked for "defined(CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_PYPY)" (which is always true) instead of the defined 0/1 value.
Add a special case for the Limited API and restrict the assert work-arounds to CPython.
Rewrite to correctly support the CyFunction struct layout in the Limited API and to make the (non-)acceptance of CyFunction (in addition to plain PyCFunction) explicit.
Add void* cast to correctly pass a function pointer.

It's probably ok to apply the unpacking of unbound methods to any PyCFunction, including subclasses.
Due to a bug, we weren't doing the type check at all before, which meant that PyCFunction_GET_SELF() could actually fail.

title: Clean up special handling of PyCFunction and CyFunction
